elements.name: ref
elements.desc: defines a reference to another location, possibly modified by additional text or comment.

elements.name: name
elements.desc: contains a proper noun or noun phrase.

elements.name: rs
elements.desc: contains a general purpose name or referring string.

elements.name: num
elements.desc: supplies the value of the number in standard form.

elements.name: measure
elements.desc: specifies the type of measurement in any convenient typology.

elements.name: time
elements.desc: contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format.

elements.name: date
elements.desc: contains a date in any format.

elements.name: email
elements.desc:
contains an email address identifying a location to which
        email messages can be delivered.

elements.name: expan
elements.desc: contains the expansion of an abbreviation.

elements.name: abbr
elements.desc: the abbreviation is for a geographic name.

elements.name: orig
elements.desc:
contains a reading which is marked as following the original, rather than being normalized
        or corrected.

elements.name: supplied
elements.desc:
one or more words indicating why the text has had to be supplied, e.g.
      <mentioned>overbinding</mentioned>, <mentioned>faded-ink</mentioned>, <mentioned>lost-folio</mentioned>, <mentioned>omitted-in-original</mentioned>.

elements.name: corr
elements.desc: contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text.

elements.name: reg
elements.desc: contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized in some sense.

elements.name: unclear
elements.desc: damage results from smoke

elements.name: del
elements.desc:
contains a letter, word, or passage deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as
    superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, or a previous annotator or corrector.

elements.name: sic
elements.desc: contains text reproduced although apparently incorrect or inaccurate.

elements.name: add
elements.desc:
contains letters, words, or phrases inserted in the source
  text by an author, scribe, or a previous annotator or corrector.

elements.name: term
elements.desc:
contains a single-word, multi-word, or symbolic
    designation which is regarded as a technical term.

elements.name: foreign
elements.desc:
identifies a word or phrase as belonging to some language other than that of the
                surrounding text.

elements.name: title
elements.desc:
descriptive paraphrase of the work
functioning as a title

elements.name: hi
elements.desc:
marks a word or phrase as graphically distinct from the
        surrounding text, for reasons concerning which no claim is
        made.

elements.name: rhyme
elements.desc:
provides a label
      (usually a single letter) to identify which part of a rhyme scheme this rhyming string
        instantiates.

elements.name: seg
elements.desc: represents any segmentation of text below the <soCalled>chunk</soCalled> level.

elements.name: s
elements.desc: contains a sentence-like division of a text.

elements.name: measure
elements.desc: specifies the type of measurement in any convenient typology.

elements.name: p
elements.desc: marks paragraphs in prose.
